objinfo.medium: water-based tempera with a glue and/or gum binder and with pen and ink outlining

provenance.name: Tate Collection
provenance.note: Acquired, and probably commissioned, from Blake by Thomas Butts, c. 1799-1800; by inheritance in 1845 to Thomas Butts, Jr.; by inheritance in 1862 to Capt. F. J. Butts; offered Sotheby's, 24 June 1903, lot 14 (£28 apparently bought-in by "Dimsdale," possibly Major T. E. Dimsdale); his widow; sold April 1906 through Carfax & Co. to W. Graham Robertson; sold from his collection, Christie's, 22 July 1949, lot 30 (£420 to the executors of Robertson's estate for presentation through the National Art Collections Fund to the Tate Gallery, now Tate Collection).

desc.objtitle: The Agony in the Garden, Object 1 (Butlin 425)

objnote.p: Blake signed the work with his monogram, lower right; see the textual transcription. An enhanced image of the monogram has been provided below. The edges of the painting are damaged; the corners have been trimmed diagonally. The painting was restored in 1917 and again in 1949. According to Butlin 425, "the original paint is missing in many places."

illustration.illusobjdesc: This design illustrates Jesus's agony in the garden of Gethsemane (Luke 22:41-44). In the center of the design kneels Jesus, facing away but with his head bent up. His is bending, perhaps falling, backward. He wears a gown, has long hair and a beard, and raises his arms at 45 degrees, a posture that suggests his later crucifixion. He may be looking at the angel above him. Above Jesus, bending down and seen from behind, though looking slightly forward, is a (male?) angel. The angel is nude from the waist up and has long hair. He holds Jesus around his waist. The angel is surrounded by a cloud; a burst of fiery light emanates from his waist. In the foreground are hints of grass, though it is dark. This may be a night scene. At least six tree trunks with hints of leafy branches are visible. To the left of Jesus, amidst the tree trunks, is a shadowy figure. This may be a sleeping disciple, as his eyes appear to be closed. He appears to have long hair and faces right, sitting or crouching. He wears a cloak or some other item of clothing with a hood. To the right of Jesus are two more shadowy figures, probably disciples, amidst the trees. The left figure faces forward and sits or crouches, perhaps leaning on a tree trunk. He appears to have long, curly hair and his eyes are closed. He may be sleeping. The figure to the right sits or crouches, facing left, with his eyes closed. He has long(?) hair and a beard. He may also be sleeping.

component.illusobjdesc: In the center of the design kneels Jesus, facing away but with his head bent up. He is bending, perhaps falling, backward. He wears a gown, has long hair and a beard, and raises his arms at 45 degrees, a posture that suggests his later crucifixion. He may be looking at the angel above him.

Above Jesus, bending down and seen from behind, though looking slightly forward, is a (male?) angel. The angel is nude from the waist up and has long hair. His arms are raised vertically, in relation to his body, and he holds Jesus around his waist. The angel is surrounded by a cloud; a burst of fiery light emanates from his waist.

In the foreground of this garden scene are hints of grass, though it is dark. This may be a night scene. At least six tree trunks with hints of leafy branches are visible. The ground rises to the right and left, although it might be wrong to claim that these mounds are hills.

To the left of Jesus, amidst the tree trunks, is a shadowy figure. This may be a sleeping disciple, as his eyes appear to be closed. He appears to have long hair and faces right, sitting or crouching. He wears a cloak or some other item of clothing with a hood.

To the right of Jesus are two shadowy figures amidst the trees, both probably disciples. The left figure faces forward and sits or crouches, perhaps leaning on a tree trunk. He appears to have long, curly hair and his eyes are closed. He may be sleeping.

To the right of Jesus are two shadowy figures amidst the trees, both probably disciples. The figure to the right sits or crouches, facing left, with his eyes closed. He has long(?) hair and a beard. He may be sleeping. The mound below his head may be his left knee.

lg.l: WBButlin 425 records "inv" as part of the "damaged" monogram. A loop appears to extend upwards from the "B" in "WB," but no "inv" inscription is now visible where it may have once appeared above "WB."
